poem:
### Shenandoah Silence

In Harrisonburg, where echoes of the valley  
once played on strings of Salvadorian bands,  
a hush settles,  
the soccer fields lie still,  
the taco trucks idle  
in a sun-stilled afternoon.  
Only the mountains remember  
the music of lives,  
now wrapped in the folds of silence,  
blowing gently with the valley's breath.
